intro: Calyptranthes affinis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture with a slightly waxy appearance. Calyptranthes affinis is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
